instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00923 - no display
threads.message:
Water damaged. Ok on external display but blank screen on internal lcd also on test lcd.

PP5V_S0SW_LCD 0V. Any idea?

threads.title: 820-00923 - no display
threads.message:
Any liquid sign on LCD connector?
CPU eDP output has no protection at all, directly connected to J8500.

threads.title: 820-00923 - no display
threads.message: There is a pin burnt in lcd connector on lcd side and on connector cable. Replaced it and tried with test lcd but it's like it is not recognised. I'm thinking to lift U8510 and measure  EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN. I can't se other ways to do it.

threads.title: 820-00923 - no display
threads.message:
"There is a pin burnt in lcd connector"
Which pin corresponds in schematic?

You can still arm a big iMac using a 42" TV...

threads.title: 820-00923 - no display
threads.message: Just measured the LVDS cable connector. It is pin 1 (EDP_INT_AUX_N).There is only 80ohm between pin 1 and the next pin 43 (PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT).

threads.title: 820-00923 - no display
threads.message:
Classic overvoltage from backlight output.
If you cannot change CPU, think about mentioned iMac option...
